description: The library has several rooms reservable for groups of two to ten people equipped with white boards perfect for your study session.

Located on the first floor of the library, the Instruction Room is a space equipped with tables, rolling chairs, and an instructor station with seating for 30 students. This space is perfect for evening workshops, co-curricular groups, and large study groups. This room must be reserved 8 hours in advance.
The library has two individual study rooms featuring a desk and a chair that can be reserved, perfect for working by yourself. Ask for help at the Info Desk if you need help finding your room!

Six group study rooms are available for general use on a first-come, first-served basis. Rooms include 309, 308, 322, and 321 on the Third floor, and 414 and 415 on the Fourth floor. They contain 3 to 7 chairs with space appropriate for small groups. Please tidy up when you are finished using the rooms and do not "camp out" for extended periods of time.

The Education, Health and Human Services building has four Team Rooms available by reservation or on a first come first serve basis. Reservations must be made a day in advance by contacting Suzie Davis in the Gary Strong Curriculum Center at <sldavis@uidaho.edu>. Located on the 2nd and 4th floors (rooms 215, 217, 415, 417), the rooms are equipped with two white boards and a TV monitor, with a max capacity of 9 people. Great for collaborating with classmates and/or colleagues.

Located on the Library's first floor, the Studio offers dedicated space to UI-affiliated students, staff, and faculty to record, edit, or digitize audiovisual content. Faculty and staff can capture high-quality lectures and instructional videos using the eGlass and other equipment. Students, staff, and faculty can use the Studio to support their teaching, learning, and creative pursuits at the University of Idaho. Visit the Studio Homepage for more information.

The library's two LulzBot TAZ Workhorse 3D printers are located in the MILL (Making Innovating and Learning Laboratory) on the 1st floor of the library and can be reserved to print your project. Visit the MILL's website for further information.

The MILL has a Glowforge with an attached filtration unit. This amazing machine can cut and engrave acrylic, wood, and vegetable-tanned leather. The Glowforge can be reserved by U of I students, staff, and faculty. Users are responsible to bring in their own materials from our approved list of items.

The library has twelve rooms reservable by graduate students. These rooms include a desk, chair, and shelf and can be reserved for semesters at a time. For more information, to reserve a study carrel, or to be added to the wait list, please email libcirc@uidaho.edu.
